title: I just played ARAM all day and didn't witness a single dodge
body: Thank you, Riot, for putting rerolled champions into a bin for everyone to pick from.

replies.body:

Now that'd be something I'd like.

>

Or they could NOT HAVE NONE LISTED AS A BAN...

Like really, whats the point of that? so some smurf can feel good about roflstomping low elo because he "doesnt ban champs"
The smurf in question would just ban some never ever played champion and it would be the same outcome,
Banning some never-played champion means you have a chance of banning some OTP's pick. That's actually far more helpful even than a random Yasuo ban.
So if I don't have amyone I want to ban, and my allies don't respond to "Ban Requests?", what should I do? Just ban random shit?

Yes. Ban something that only OTPs play. That way they're fucked over a good amount if you happen to be against someone that mains it.

Also, 99% of the people who just ban none don't even ask for a request. They just wait until the absolute last possible second and ban none.

But I might fuck over my teammates by banning an otp pick.

And the reason most people don't ask is nobody's paying attention anyway. I get a response like once every 5-10 lobbies.

I don't really care either way but...

opgg exists.

Just look at high winrate high playrate (combined) champions and ban one.
I mean the same outcome technically happens if he bans the same person someone on the enemy team does.

The point of giving everyone a ban, is because when they first gave us that ability, the intent was that each person could ban whoever they didn't want to lane against. If someone feels up to it, there's no real problem if they don't want to ban anyone.

replies.body: I also play ARAM only and I myself dislike most of the new changes. I don't like the new bench in champion select and I don't like the new boots and assassin item. I also dislike the removal of Warmogs and the Butcher's Bridge's colours. I love the new healing system (even tho' in my opinion, it could be tuned a bit) and I like the new AP item.

I agree specifically with the bench in champ select. With 3 or 4 rerolls on the table it gives you way too much power to actually build a predetermined composition, pretty much defeating the purpose of ARAM. I'm sure people that weren't exclusively ARAM players will enjoy this because it makes it feel a little more like Rift, but as a purely ARAM player this feels like a very bad core change to the only mode I play. But I suppose as with anything in League, c'est la.

Now revolutionize Summoner's Rift as properly as this was done, and maybe I'll feel compelled to play that shit again.

I love the new lethality item there, any assassin can now be Zed: go in, have 4 seconds to kill, teleport back to safety. Awesome idea.

My only issue is that even suppressed the player just poofs back.

This shouldn't happen. It shouldn't be a free get out of jail card for being stupid.

I honestly think it's fair. You know how Ziggs, Lux, and Ezreal (don't even get me started on the cancer zyra and brand) are on this map. That's a literal permanent get out of jail free card. 

Even then, you're retreating backwards, while ranged champions still have their ranges. In that way, you kinda came out on the wrong side of the trade if you didn't fully kill them. Meaning they'll go back to using their range as annoyingly as possible.

I say this as someone who has played a shit ton of aram, with a shit ton of champs, tanks, adc, support, mages, xeraths.
Its actually harder than it looks. They can easily kill you in 4 secs as well. I usually use it and wait till only 1-2 seconds are left before engaging so they cant react in time

Nah people still dodge... the fix is so freaking super easy tho…. 

Just lock in the champion for the player, so on a dodge on next sign he or she will get the same champion again.
So there is no point in dodging and waiting 5 minutes as you gonna get the SAME champ again with 0 rerolls.

Your welcome Riot.

Maybe that would work, but then eyeone else in the game would have no chance of “randomly” getting that champ since it has been locked in for the payer dogged. Who knows maybe people will doge when they get a good champ but don’t like their team comp.

If the chance of getting a good champ + bad team is less than the chance of getting a bad champ, then it still reduces dodges.

As for locked in vs "randomly" getting a champion, it's not really different than what happens now. Player 2 can't get what Player 1 was rolled, Player 3 can't get what 1 or 2 rolled, Player 4 can't get what 1, 2, or 3 rolled, and Player 5 can't get what 1, 2, 3, or 4 rolled. The only difference is that Player 1 is the guy who dodged and they're roll happened earlier.

This can be exploited and would cause issues.

Get a champion you like with your premade? Dodge, eat the pathetically small "punishment" timer, and then come into the next queue with the champion you want.

This will be done ad nauseam with the same inbred clowns who have multiple accounts to dodge more.

Leaving the game to play a champion you were going to play anyways...

Just so your friends can gamble on rerolls?

Yes, this will occur.

People queue up for "random" and dodge because they don't like "random." So, as stupid as those people are, there will be people who exploit it. There are ALWAYS people who ruin good things for everyone.

Like people who abuse multiple accounts so they can dodge everything with zero repercussions until they get what they want.
Aram changes are positive! I also like how the heal was reworked so when you 95% hp teammate takes it then you can still heal.

The atmosphere this Aram gives is...excitting. Too excitted and thrived in battle to tilt om the first place.
Also being able to change multiple champions is nice.
Yeah, this new ARAM change is amazing.

I get what people are saying about the bench possibly giving more of a predetermined comp and that was one of my fears as well. But at the end of the day it is still random and one team can still get the luckier comp. And I played games last night where no one RR or only one person did and no one chose the champ they ditched. So overall I see it as a positive change. You are a bit less likely to have that person raging because they got what they perceive to be a weak ARAM champ and they have no rr and no one will trade with them (even though I don't think there are any weak ARAM champs...just some champs that may not stack up well against the enemy teams comp or champs that you don't know how to play). 

I found Butcher's Bridge to be a bit jarring at first because I am so used to The Howling Abyss but by the end of the night I was really loving it. Love the new heal packs and the new items and in a few instances saw them used to good effect. Saw Pyke a few times and he definitely looked fun and seemed strong but not completely OP. Don't mind the Warmog's change too much because I rarely bought it myself. I feel like there were usually better choices to make as tanks. The one downside to its loss is when playing against a team that has a champ that naturally has a Warmog's like ability built into their kit (Garen, Mundo).
Now just give us back the mog.

I have still seen plenty of dodges. The champ rr'ed pool is nice though. Even though I burned a rr just to take the champ out of the pool because I forgot about it initially. 
Doesn't seem easier to get an s though..

As an ARAM OTP who own every champion and with 8052 ARAM matches currently played, I feared any ARAM change would just make it worse (such as the introduction of Mark/Dash).

But this is actually rather excellent. Increased reroll speed, the champion bin to choose from (no longer having to worry about someone rolling without asking - which, as far as I'm concerned is a reportable offense for negative atttude), and the AOE glyphs (adding an actual strategic elemen to the mode).

Now, as soon as I learn the respawn rates, and people realize the ones who takes the glyph receives some additional healing and mana, this really could be made permanent.

And, unlike the Gangplank announcer which I muted after 2 matches, I actually like the Pyke announcer.
